entries.meaning: (set theory, of a set S) A set A such that every element of A is also an element of S.
examples: The set of integers is a subset of the set of real numbers.

entries.meaning: A group of things or people, all of which are in a specified larger group.
examples: We asked a subset of the population of the town for their opinion.

verbs.description: subset (third-person singular simple present subsets, present participle subsetting, simple past and past participle subsetted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, computing, typography) To extract only the portions of (a font) that are needed to display a particular document.
